intro: Cynoctonum myrtifolium, commonly known as the Myrtle-leaved Cynoctonum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a fragrant, slightly oily texture. The flowers are usually pink or white, and they bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
